page.title: 04Local History Soho Farm
page.content: Soho Farm was originally a summer Mansion,built by Mrs.Tate (Tate and Lyle sugar)and is at least 250 years old.It became known as Soho Farm in 1900.Near the Farm house on the B4309 road there are the remains of a Toll house.Many years ago people had to pay to go through this gate.By 1838 the people were so fed up that a group of men dressed up as women,so as not to be identified,smashed all the gates and Toll houses.These men were called the Rebecca Rioters.Today the Farm has 197 acres.-25 acres of vegetables,30 acres of grain and 142 acres of hay and mixed forests.There are the remains of a Roman Fort in one of these forests.A Roman Battle also took place on land belonging to Soho Farm- which forms part of the 'Stradey Estate'.
